last_episode_to_air.name: DeMarcus Ware
last_episode_to_air.overview: DeMarcus Ware's presence on the field was remarkable. This week, “A Football Life” tells the story of this Hall of Famer’s legendary career.

name: A Football Life
overview:
A Football Life is a documentary series developed by NFL Films and aired on NFL Network that documents the lives of select National Football League players, coaches, owners, and teams. Friends, teammates, family members and other players and coaches associated with the subjects are interviewed.

The name of the series originated in a quote from Steve Sabol of NFL Films:

Originating as an NFL Network special on the career of Bill Parcells in November 2010, it premiered as an episodic series on September 15, 2011, with the first part of Bill Belichick's documentary. The documentary was viewed by about 657,000 viewers, the most-watched documentary in NFL Network's history, and was the second-most watched program in Boston at the time with 151,000 viewers, trailing behind a Boston Red Sox game. Season One was eventually released on DVD.

Season Two began on September 12, 2012, with The Faces of Tebow.

The series was nominated for an Emmy Award for "Outstanding Edited Sports Series/Anthology" and "Outstanding Promotional Announcement – Episodic" for Belichick's episode in 2012.

seasons.name: Season 4
seasons.overview: Season four was announced for September 10, 2014. From the promotional trailers running on NFL Network episodes can be expected featuring stars like Terrell Davis, Lyle Alzado, Joe Greene, Eric Dickerson, Bill Walsh, Ricky Williams, Sean Taylor, Roger Staubach, and Doug Flutie.

seasons.name: Season 5
seasons.overview: Season five has14 new episodes including Terrell Owens, Dick Vermeil, Paul Brown, and more.

seasons.name: Season 6
seasons.overview: Season Six premieres Friday, September 16 at 9:00 PM ET and will air 13 new episodes starting with the story of Pro Football Hall of Fame running back Curtis Martin. Other episodes will include Brett Favre, Chuck Noll, Jim Brown, and more.

seasons.name: Season 7
seasons.overview: A Football Life is a documentary series developed by NFL Films and aired on NFL Network that documents the lives of select National Football League players, coaches, owners, and teams. Friends, teammates, family members and other players and coaches associated with the subjects are interviewed.

episodes.name: Bill Belichick - Part 1
episodes.overview: A Football Life takes an in-depth look at the life of one of the NFL's most intriguing coaches, Bill Belichick, using unique on and off-the-field sights, sounds and stories. Part 1 of 2.

episodes.name: Bill Belichick - Part 2
episodes.overview: A Football Life takes an in-depth look at the life of one of the NFL's most intriguing coaches, Bill Belichick, using unique on and off-the-field sights, sounds and stories. Part 2 of 2.

episodes.name: Reggie White & Jerome Brown
episodes.overview: A Football Life takes an in-depth look at the lives and relationship of NFL Defensive Linemen, Reggie White and Jerome Brown, using unique on and off-the-field sights, sounds and stories.

episodes.name: Kurt Warner
episodes.overview: A Football Life takes an in-depth look at the life of NFL quarterback, Kurt Warner, using unique on and off-the-field sights, sounds and stories.

episodes.name: Walter Payton
episodes.overview: A Football Life takes an in-depth look at the life of NFL running back great, Walter Payton, using unique on and off-the-field sights, sounds and stories.

episodes.name: Ed Sabol
episodes.overview: A Football Life takes an in-depth look at the life of NFL filmmaker, Ed Sabol, using unique on and off-the-field sights, sounds and stories.

episodes.name: Mike Ditka
episodes.overview: A Football Life takes an in-depth look at the life of NFL coach ,Mike Ditka, using unique on and off-the-field sights, sounds and stories.

episodes.name: Tom Landry
episodes.overview: A Football Life takes an in-depth look at the life of NFL coach ,Tom Landry, using unique on and off-the-field sights, sounds and stories.

episodes.name: Al Davis
episodes.overview: A Football Life takes an in-depth look at the life of former NFL coach, general manager, commissioner, and owner, Al Davis, using unique on and off-the-field sights, sounds and stories.

episodes.name: Ray Lewis
episodes.overview: A look at Baltimore Ravens linebacker Ray Lewis, whose inspiration and leadership not only has a profound effect on his teammates, but also, his coaches.

episodes.name: Tom Coughlin
episodes.overview: Profile of Giants Head Coach Tom Coughlin, who has brought two Super Bowl championships to the “Big Apple” in the past five years.

episodes.name: Cleveland '95
episodes.overview: The untold story of Bill Belichick's Cleveland Browns and a talented staff who rose from the ashes of the 1995 season.

episodes.name: Fearsome Foursome
episodes.overview: The life and times of arguably the greatest defensive line in football history. A Football Life takes an in-depth look at the Fearsome Foursome using unique on and off-the-field sights, sounds and stories.

episodes.name: Steve McNair: A Football Life
episodes.overview: A Football Life launches its sixth episode of the season, featuring the late, great Steve McNair.

episodes.name: Eddie DeBartolo, Jr.
episodes.overview: Known to everyone in the 49ers family as “Mr. D.”, the beloved Eddie DeBartolo won the hearts of many in the city of San Francisco during his tenure as team owner. Under DeBartolo, the 49ers became a dynasty that captured 13 division titles and 5 Super Bowl trophies.

episodes.name: Chris Spielman
episodes.overview: The inspiring story of former linebacker Chris Spielman and the strength of his family.

episodes.name: Jimmy Johnson
episodes.overview: The career of Jimmy Johnson, best known for architecting the Dallas Cowboys’ success in 1992 and 1993.

episodes.name: John Riggins
episodes.overview: A look at Hall of Famer John Riggins, whose smash-mouth style of running the football earned him the nickname “The Diesel.

episodes.name: Barry Sanders
episodes.overview: A Football Life series continues as the life and career of one of the best and most elusive runners in history is examined.

episodes.name: Marcus Allen
episodes.overview: A Football Life profiles the career of Marcus Allen, best known for his MVP performance against the Washington Redskins in Super Bowl XVIII. His 74-yard touchdown run solidified a Super Bowl victory for the Los Angeles Raiders in 1984.

episodes.name: The Immaculate Reception
episodes.overview: In the epic conclusion of this year’s season of “A Football Life,” the most famous play in NFL history gets further investigation 40 years after it occurred.

episodes.name: Randall Cunningham
episodes.overview: A Football Life honors the life and career of one of the most influential players of his time. Now 50, Cunningham is a born-again minister who tragically lost one son and is in the midst of watching another become a football star of his own.

episodes.name: Cris Carter
episodes.overview: A Football Life honors the life and career of legendary wide receiver Cris Carter with an all access look at his induction into the Pro Football Hall of Fame, the culmination of a roller coaster career.

episodes.name: The Forward Pass
episodes.overview: 2013 marks the 100th anniversary of the official arrival of the forward pass - the most significant rule change in the history of sports. Sparked by a health and safety crisis that threatened the future of football, the forward pass has become the defining play in America's Game.

episodes.name: Steve Gleason
episodes.overview: A Football Life honors the life of the former Saints star, now battling ALS.

episodes.name: The Great Wall of Dallas
episodes.overview: A Football Life honors perhaps the most dominant offensive line in NFL history, who paved the way for Emmitt Smith and a Dallas dynasty but suffered the pitfalls of fame and fortune along the way.

episodes.name: Houston '93
episodes.overview: In 1993 the high-flying Houston Oilers fielded one of the most talented teams in football, expected by many to represent the AFC in the Super Bowl. What ensued was one of the wildest, most controversial seasons any team has ever had, a season that may have changed the course of pro football in one of America's largest cities.

episodes.name: Marty Schottenheimer
episodes.overview: A Football Life honor's the life of the NFL's Ahab, a man who never quite caught his white whale, but put together one of the most successful head coaching careers of the past 40 years.

episodes.name: Vince Lombardi (1)
episodes.overview: Part 1 of the Vince Lombardi story chronicles the legendary coach’s rise from his Brooklyn youth to the sidelines of Lambeau Field.

episodes.name: Vince Lombardi (2)
episodes.overview: Part 2 of the Vince Lombardi story details the final years of his life, from his three-peat in Green Bay to his brief tenure as head coach in Washington and sudden, tragic death from cancer.

episodes.name: Tiki & Ronde Barber
episodes.overview: A Football Life chronicles the identical twins who dominated the game but ended their careers in very different ways.

episodes.name: Bill Parcells
episodes.overview: A Football Life examines the career of legendary coach Bill Parcells.

episodes.name: Jerry Smith
episodes.overview: Almost 50 years ago, a young tight end named Jerry Smith joined the Washington Redskins. After 13 seasons on the team, Smith retired, but not before making two Pro Bowls, one All-Pro team, and playing in the Super Bowl. He set an NFL record with 60 receiving touchdowns, the most ever by a tight end (that record stood for 26 years). Smith was also gay, something that caused him to live a life in constant fear and tension.

episodes.name: Jerry Rice
episodes.overview: A Football Life chronicles the story of how an unrecruited small-town wide receiver became the Greatest Of All Time.

episodes.name: "Mean Joe" Greene
episodes.overview: The life and times of Mean Joe Greene, foundation of the Steel Curtain and the first Pittsburgh Steeler to have his number retired in 50 years.

episodes.name: Brandon Marshall
episodes.overview: The inspiring story of Brandon Marshall, who has become the national face of borderline personality disorder and one of the NFL's best wide receivers.

episodes.name: Sean Taylor
episodes.overview: The life and death of the Washington Redskins late, beloved all-pro safety Sean Taylor.

episodes.name: Warren Moon
episodes.overview: Warren Moon was as physically gifted as any quarterback, but prejudices almost robbed him of opportunities until his talent proved he belonged with the best.

episodes.name: Eric Dickerson
episodes.overview: The smooth, bespectacled Hall-of-Famer whose career was as distinctive as his running style.

episodes.name: Doug Flutie
episodes.overview: The world said he was too small, however, Doug Flutie has left a giant imprint on the football world.

episodes.name: Terrell Davis
episodes.overview: A look at the career of Terrell Davis, a two-time NFL Offensive Player of the Year and the Broncos all-time rushing leader.

episodes.name: Ricky Williams
episodes.overview: A look at the life and career of Heisman Trophy-winning tailback Ricky Williams, who was drafted by the New Orleans Saints in 1999 and played 11 seasons in the NFL.

episodes.name: Earl Campbell
episodes.overview: A look at the life of Earl Campbell, a premiere running back at both the collegiate and professional levels. Earl won the Heisman trophy while playing at the University of Texas and went on to be the first overall pick in the 1978 NFL draft. He has since been inducted into both the collegiate and NFL halls of fame.

episodes.name: The Perfect Backfield
episodes.overview: Larry Csonka, Jim Kiick, and Eugene ''Mercury'' Morris, the three running backs who led the Dolphins in the 1970s, reunite in present-day Alaska.

episodes.name: Lyle Alzado
episodes.overview: "Three Mile" Lyle Alzado became one of the most dominant pass rushers in the NFL and even fought Muhammad Ali, all while concealing a secret that would rock the sports world.

episodes.name: Dick Butkus & Gale Sayers
episodes.overview: A look at the careers of Bears greats Dick Butkus and Gale Sayers, who were drafted with back-to-back first-round picks in 1965 and went on to become Hall of Famers.

episodes.name: Roger Staubach
episodes.overview: A look at the career of Roger Staubach, who won the Heisman Trophy for Navy in 1963 and went on to have a Hall of Fame career with the Dallas Cowboys.

episodes.name: Keenan McCardell & Jimmy Smith
episodes.overview: A look at the careers of wide receivers Keenan McCardell and Jimmy Smith, who were known as "Thunder and Lightning" when they played together for Jacksonville from 1996-2001.

episodes.name: 2006 Rose Bowl
episodes.overview: The legacy of one of the greatest college football games ever played, the 2006 Rose Bowl that matched USC and Texas in a battle of undefeated teams.

episodes.name: Bill Walsh
episodes.overview: Bill Walsh was knows as a genius but was also an insecure, tortured artist. After revolutionizing the NFL with the ``Team of the 80s,'' he wrote a book that has become the bible for generations of football coaches.

episodes.name: Joe Namath, part 1
episodes.overview: Part 1 of the extraordinary life of Joe Namath. From his childhood in Beaver Falls, PA to Tuscaloosa and Bear Bryant to the bright lights of Broadway, how Namath became football's star of stars.

episodes.name: Joe Namath, part 2
episodes.overview: Part 2 of the extraordinary life of Joe Namath, from the high of the Super Bowl III to the lows of a life lived too hard, and back to the place he was born in Western PA.

4.name: Season 4
4.overview: Season four was announced for September 10, 2014. From the promotional trailers running on NFL Network episodes can be expected featuring stars like Terrell Davis, Lyle Alzado, Joe Greene, Eric Dickerson, Bill Walsh, Ricky Williams, Sean Taylor, Roger Staubach, and Doug Flutie.

episodes.name: Christian Okoye
episodes.overview: The story of Christian Okoye, football's Nigerian Nightmare, who left an indelible impression on the game and his opponents.

episodes.name: Dexter Manley
episodes.overview: The rise, fall, and redemption of Dexter Manley, one of the most dominant and beloved players in Washington history. Known as the "Secretary of Defense," he was functionally illiterate and became addicted to drugs.

episodes.name: Jerome Bettis
episodes.overview: A profile of running back Jerome Bettis, who went from Detroit to Notre Dame, Los Angeles to Pittsburgh and finally to the Hall of Fame in Canton.

episodes.name: Terrell Owens
episodes.overview: A profile of Terrell Owens, one of the most talented and polarizing players in NFL history.

episodes.name: Alan Page
episodes.overview: One of the most impressive careers in pro football history was just the beginning for the great Alan Page.

episodes.name: Steve Largent
episodes.overview: A profile of NFL Hall of Famer and former congressman Steve Largent.

episodes.name: Dick Vermeil
episodes.overview: A profile of coach Dick Vermeil, who took three separate teams to the playoffs and won Super bowl XXXIV with the Rams.

episodes.name: Paul Brown
episodes.overview: A profile of Hall of Fame coach Paul Brown, who built the Cleveland Browns into a championship team in the 1940s and helped invent the modern game.

episodes.name: Mike Singletary
episodes.overview: A profile of Hall of Famer Mike Singletary, the centerpiece of the famed Chicago Bears defense of the mid-1980s.

episodes.name: Charles Haley
episodes.overview: A profile of Hall of Fame coach Paul Brown, who built the Cleveland Browns into a championship team in the 1940s and helped invent the modern game.

episodes.name: Bruce Arians
episodes.overview: The extraordinary story of the lifelong assistant turned overnight success who has led the Arizona Cardinals back into contention.

episodes.name: Marshall Faulk
episodes.overview: One of most exciting and dynamic players in NFL history, Marshall Faulk rose from the streets of New Orleans to launch the Greatest Show on Turf.

5.name: Season 5
5.overview: Season five has14 new episodes including Terrell Owens, Dick Vermeil, Paul Brown, and more.

episodes.name: Curtis Martin
episodes.overview: The inspiring story of Curtis Martin, who rose from the streets of Pittsburgh to become a Hall of Fame running back.

episodes.name: Rodney Harrison
episodes.overview: One of football’s greatest safeties and one of its most controversial players remains a vital and passionate voice of the game.

episodes.name: Chad Johnson
episodes.overview: The unpredictable life of the endzone dancing, trash talking, name-changing receiver who was "always open".

episodes.name: Steve Young
episodes.overview: The long climb to the top for Hall of Fame quarterback Steve Young, as told by Young himself through excerpts from his autobiography.

episodes.name: Brett Favre
episodes.overview: This fall "A Football Life" returns for its sixth season featuring some of the most memorable personalities to play the game, including a young man from Kiln, Mississippi who created a legacy in Green Bay that took him all the way to the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

episodes.name: Pat Tillman
episodes.overview: The extraordinary life and legacy of the Arizona Cardinal who left the NFL to defend his country after 9/11.

episodes.name: Michael Vick
episodes.overview: The most exciting player of his generation relives his rise, fall and long road to redemption.

episodes.name: Kevin Greene
episodes.overview: The story of the boisterous sackmaster who blitzed his way to the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

6.name: Season 6
6.overview: Season Six premieres Friday, September 16 at 9:00 PM ET and will air 13 new episodes starting with the story of Pro Football Hall of Fame running back Curtis Martin. Other episodes will include Brett Favre, Chuck Noll, Jim Brown, and more.

episodes.name: Dan Marino
episodes.overview: The singular talent and legacy of Hall of Famer Dan Marino, The Quarterback’s Quarterback.

episodes.name: Emmitt Smith
episodes.overview: Emmitt Smith makes an indelible impact on the game of football and builds a case as the greatest running back of all time by breaking one of the NFL’s hallowed records and making everyone around him better.

episodes.name: John Madden
episodes.overview: The many football lives of Raiders Hall of Fame coach, broadcaster, commercial star and video game pioneer John Madden.

episodes.name: Wes Welker
episodes.overview: Undersized and unwanted, Wes Welker overcomes obstacles to re-define the role of the slot receiver in the NFL.

episodes.name: Sam Mills
episodes.overview: He was once deemed too short to play in the NFL, but Sam Mills became an All-Pro and built a legacy that still looms larger than life.

episodes.name: Jim Kelly
episodes.overview: How does a man emerge a champion after a life filled with loss? Leading the Buffalo Bills to four straight Super Bowls is only part of Jim Kelly’s legend

episodes.name: Larry Fitzgerald
episodes.overview: The globetrotting journey of Larry Fitzgerald a man who’s caught more than 1,000 passes, scored more than 100 touchdowns, visited nearly 100 countries, and lived one fascinating Football Life.

episodes.name: Eddie George
episodes.overview: Eddie George played football for his father. After a brilliant career at Ohio State and with the Tennessee Titans, he started acting for himself.

episodes.name: Joe Gibbs
episodes.overview: Hall of Fame Head Coach Joe Gibbs tries to balance his personal and professional life while building the NFL’s most diverse dynasty.

episodes.name: Jerry Jones
episodes.overview: Jerry Jones works his way up from greeter at his parents grocery store in Little Rock, Arkansas to become the only active owner in the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

episodes.name: Aeneas Williams
episodes.overview: Aeneas Williams’ long journey from college walk-on to Hall of Fame defensive back to pastor in Ferguson, Missouri.

episodes.name: John Randle
episodes.overview: Passed over by every NFL team, John Randle's madcap antics vault the undrafted free agent from rags to riches and stardom with the Minnesota Vikings and Seattle Seahawks.

episodes.name: Lynn Swann & John Stallworth
episodes.overview: Two different personalities, two separate paths, one shared drive for greatness: the rivalry, friendship and artistry of Pittsburgh Steelers Hall of Fame receivers Lynn Swann and John Stallworth.

7.name: Season 7
7.overview: A Football Life is a documentary series developed by NFL Films and aired on NFL Network that documents the lives of select National Football League players, coaches, owners, and teams. Friends, teammates, family members and other players and coaches associated with the subjects are interviewed.

episodes.name: Carson Palmer
episodes.overview: The golden boy with the golden arm won the Heisman Trophy at USC and was the first overall pick in the 2003 NFL draft. In the NFL, he endured two torn ACLs, two trades, and one very public disagreement with an owner. But he still managed a 15-year career, and currently ranks 12th all-time in passing yards and touchdown passes.

episodes.name: Lawrence Taylor
episodes.overview: L.T. has been in the spotlight from the moment he stepped into the NFL, and as destructive as he was on the field as one of the best defensive players of all time, he may have been more destructive to himself off the field. Through three decades of interviews, Taylor gives raw, unfiltered, honest answers about the highest and lowest points in a triumphant and tumultuous football life.

episodes.name: Tony Romo
episodes.overview: The story of how a perfectionist with a love for sports went from small-town Wisconsin to become the face of America's Team for nearly a decade.

episodes.name: Willie McGinest
episodes.overview: He played for a high school known for producing NFL players. At USC he became an All American. And he helped turn the New England Patriots into a dynasty. Willie McGinest is no stranger to success, but his journey to the top of the football world had anything but a smooth start.

episodes.name: Brian Dawkins
episodes.overview: He was known as Weapon X on the field, but he was a gentle family man off it. A Football Life: Brian Dawkins looks at the two sides of Dawkins, from the beginnings of his superstar career, through his battles with depression, all the way to the Hall of Fame.

episodes.name: Dwight Clark
episodes.overview: The story of the former 49ers wide receiver who thought he wouldn't make the team, but went on to make "The Catch," arguably the single greatest reception in NFL history. The play propelled San Francisco to a decade of dominance in the 1980s that saw the team win four Super Bowl titles. Stricken with ALS in his later years, Clark died on June 4, 2018.

episodes.name: Bill Cowher
episodes.overview: He grew up in a Pittsburgh suburb, and as the Steelers head coach he won eight division titles and a Super Bowl championship. He'll always be known for his Western Pennsylvania roots and blue-collar toughness, but Bill Cowher now has a new home, and a softer side.

episodes.name: Mike Holmgren
episodes.overview: He led two franchises to the Super Bowl and did something no coach had done in Green Bay since Vince Lombardi--win a title. He's also considered one of the great quarterback whisperers of all time, having coached Hall of Famers Joe Montana, Steve Young and Brett Favre.

episodes.name: Cris Collinsworth
episodes.overview: First, he transformed from a gangly, rail-thin, 6-foot-5 Florida high school sprint champion to a star receiver for the Cincinnati Bengals. After football, he evolved from an HBO feature reporter/funnyman to the most respected and decorated analyst in sports broadcasting.

episodes.name: Doug Williams
episodes.overview: He grew up without running water in rural Louisiana. He played quarterback in an era when few African Americans did, overcoming prejudice and hardship to become a Heisman candidate, a first round draft pick, and ultimately, a Super Bowl MVP.

episodes.name: Thurman Thomas
episodes.overview: The Thurmanator led the NFL in total yards from scrimmage four straight seasons and scored a touchdown in four straight Super Bowls. Yet throughout his life, his best trait was being able to take his biggest disappointments and turn them into motivation for his greatest triumphs.

episodes.name: Terry Bradshaw
episodes.overview: A Hall of Famer who won four Super Bowls as the Steelers quarterback and still enjoys his football life today after 35 years as a television analyst.

episodes.name: Tony Gonzalez
episodes.overview: He described himself as the worst player on his youth football team, but he became the NFL's all-time leader in receptions and receiving yards by a tight end, and a first ballot Hall of Famer.

episodes.name: DeMarcus Ware
episodes.overview: DeMarcus Ware's presence on the field was remarkable. This week, “A Football Life” tells the story of this Hall of Famer’s legendary career.
